comments.content: There is so much misused jargon in there. I can't help but question the credibility of The Onion as a reliable news source.

Mr Morris backhands Mr Hutchinson for his hasty remarks, missing the subtle texan humor. Then offers him a [not too stoney beer](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015200017/http:/www.typophile.com/cgibin/board-profile.pl?action=view_profile&profile=oscar_morris-users)? Giddyup.

A satire for non-typophiles, up with which we have had to put.   
   
Cooper Black - the movie, A Note About The Type, the Very Expensive Font (Luxury, not Prokyon), and the Chalet oeuvre: much more fun for Those Who Know.

Tee hee. That Onion piece is a classic.   
   
NPR reported that a _real_ newspaper in China quoted [this entire article](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015200017/http:/www.theonion.com/onion3820/congress_threatens.html) from the Onion without realizing the mistake. I guess the writer is an actual journalist. Silly.
